Your observations seem based on your MoST architecural model.  I would like
to limit this discussion to REST.

From: "Alex Jacobson" <alex@...>
>
>At very least, you could then use 501 NOT IMPLEMENTED
> to determine whether or not the resource has the behavior you expect from
> your method.

501 cannot be used on a resource-by-resource level.  The documentation says
the respsonse is appropriate "when the server does not recognize the request
method and is not capable of supporting it for any resource."  Note the "any
resource" part.  Instead, you should be using 405 ("method not allowed").

Seairth
